title: Week In Politics: From EPA Plans To POW's Release
teaser: NPR's Ron Elving discusses new proposals to curb climate change, Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl's release and a Supreme Court ruling.
contentencoded:
This morning, the Obama Administration announced new proposals to curb climate change, American Sergeant Bowe Bergdahl was released after five years in captivity by the Taliban and the Supreme Court ruled in the chemical weapons case Bond v. United States.

That’s all in our politics segment today with NPR’s Ron Elving. He joins Here & Now’s Robin Young from Washington.

  • Read the opinion in Bond v. United States

Guest

  • Ron Elving, senior Washington editor for NPR. He tweets @relving.
